translations.translation: This meat is raw.

notes: Good examples of nominatives in this sentence. Nominatives on both subject and predicate

translations.translation: OK, this meat is/was cooked.

notes: -iyi as stative/resultative, also not true reflexive. Add to examples under reflexives

translations.translation: Come to me.

notes: locative on 1st person pronoun - not on the nominative stem? Also null imperative

translations.translation: Yes I will go to you.

notes: locative on second person; good future example too. Locative as goal of motion (not allative)

translations.translation: Go away from me.
Yes I will go away from you.

notes: good example of the "factual" suffix, translated as a future but maybe more definite? note that -ba is on a verb here, can it go on other word classes?

sentences.transcription: niladha nhaniguru buka dhithiani ngawulanga ngandrangala yanhthadhikagali

translations.translation: Yesterday those dogs came up to us at night.

notes: -guru on a nominative. what other cases can it go on? does it only go on pronouns or can it go on other items too?

translations.translation: All those dogs are coming up together.
(I) feel cold. Light the fire quick.
Stop here.

sentences.transcription: ga gulhalha nganyi nangala/ ini yanhthaba

translations.translation: Yes, I stop here, you go on.

sentences.transcription: nalyba nganyi ngandyagala gakarra nhanha ngathu makurranha

translations.translation: I want/need a knife to cut this stick.
My hand is swelling up.
Lean against this tree.
Yes, I will lean on that tree.

sentences.transcription: narrkidhikaba nganyi nhungalaguru makurralunga murra nhaniyi makurrani bulinga

translations.translation: I leaned on that tree there, OK that tree fell over.
My father died.
We will bury him.
He stabbed me a cut.

sentences.transcription: murra nhaniguru nugaani badiani/ gubianga bari ini yanhtharra

translations.translation: OK, this cut is big. I think you should go to the doctor.
The doctor will heal it.

notes: lit "good-make" - so causative on an adjective, not like the -la suffix which was on a verb.

translations.translation: OK, this cut is competely healed up.
OK, this cut will heal quickly.
Get up quick.
Get up quick, you.
Don't touch my knife.
I am sweating.
Why are you sweating?
Heat is hitting me.
Give that horse food.
A mosquito bit me - I (have an) itch.
My hand is itching.
Don't swallow that stone.
He has eaten.
Kneel.
OK I will kneel.
The dog is licking my hand.

sentences.transcription: murra dhanaguru garnaani buka marrimarrigala marniangani

translations.translation: OK, the people are dancing a ceremonial dance all together.
OK they are all dancing a ceremonial dance
Look at them.
What is the name of this dance?
This man will sing a ceremonial song.
Yes, already I am throwing this out.
Already I threw (it) out.
OK I will pluck this duck.
You plucked this.

sentences.transcription: walya ngathu bulrrangalangu nhanha/ mara badhibatu nganyi

translations.translation: No, I can't pluck (it). My hand hurts.
What happened/was done to/hurt your hand?

sentences.transcription: buligali nganyi/ mara galkaiyigali nganyi nhungalaguru makurralunga

translations.translation: I fell and hit my hand on this stick.
Tie up this string.
OK I will tie this.
Ok you all will give a share.
OK I will give them a share.

sentences.transcription: murra dhanaguru garnaani buka mula/ dhukandrinyalagala

translations.translation: Already those people are all bad. (They) fight each other.
They all will fight each other.
I eat meat all day.
I eat day after day.

sentences.transcription: mitiani ingka maraani/ yungViyiba nhungalagurru ngakalanga

translations.translation: Your hand is dirty. Wash in that water.
Yes, I wash in that water.

sentences.transcription: murra marrani nganytya dhakamunhdhu/ murra nganyi yungViyinga

translations.translation: Already my hand is clean. OK I washed.
The two of you, look at each other.
The two of us will look at each other.
OK, the two of us were looking at each other yesterday.
At the big tree.
How many kangaroos are there?
Take it out, OK.
